contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox President |name = Kessai Hesa Note |image = Kessai Note 2005.jpg |order = [[President of the Marshall Islands]] |vicepresident = |term_start = 10 January 2000 |term_end = 14 January 2008 |predecessor = [[Imata Kabua]] |successor = [[Litokwa Tomeing]] |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1950|08|07|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Ailinglaplap]], [[Ralik Chain]], [[Marshall Islands]] |death_date = |death_place = |spouse = [[Mary Neimoj Yamamura]] |party = [[United Democratic Party (Marshall Islands)|UDP]] |religion = [[Protestant]] }} '''Kessai Hesa Note''' (born August 7, 1950 in [[Ailinglaplap]]) is a former [[President of the Marshall Islands|President]] of the [[Marshall Islands]], having served from 2000 to 2008. Having served as Speaker of Parliament since 1988, he was elected President in 2000, and was the first commoner (rather than a traditional chief) to be elected to the Presidency.<ref name=Giff>Giff Johnson, [http://www.pacificmagazine.net/news/2008/01/07/opposition-takes-control-of-marshall-islands-government "Opposition Takes Control Of Marshall Islands Government"], ''Pacific Magazine'', January 7, 2008.</ref> He is a member of the [[United Democratic Party (Marshall Islands)|United Democratic Party]], and was reelected by parliament in January 2004, receiving 20 votes, while [[Justin deBrum]] received 9. On January 7, 2008, following the [[Marshall Islands general election, 2007|November 2007 general election]], he was defeated in his bid for re-election in a vote of Parliament, receiving 15 votes against 18 for [[Litokwa Tomeing]].<ref name=Giff/><ref name="RNZI_37332">{{cite news |url=http://www.rnzi.com/pages/news.php?op=read&id=37332 |title=Litokwa Tomeing becomes new Marshalls president |date=7 January 2008 |work=[[Radio New Zealand International]] |accessdate=12 October 2011}}</ref> [[File:Eni Faleomavaega and Kessai Note.jpg|left|thumb|200px|Kessai Note (right) with U.S. Delegate [[Eni Faleomavaega]].]] Note is of Japanese-Marshallese descent, having inherited his Japanese heritage from his paternal grandfather.<ref>[http://www.mofa.go.jp/mofaj/area/marshall/cv/r_note.html ケーサイ・ノート　マーシャル諸島共和国大統領略歴]</ref> Note's grandfather was a native of [[Niigata Prefecture]], and settled in the Marshall Islands during the Japanese colonial era and married a Marshallese wife.<ref>[http://globalnet-akiko.jp/mt/archives/2006/05/index.html マーシャル諸島共和国大統領会談], Official weblog of [[Akiko Yamanaka]], May 28, 2006</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * DESCRIPTION = President of the Marshall Islands | DATE OF BIRTH =7 August 1950 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Ailinglaplap]], [[Ralik Chain]], [[Marshall Islands]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }}
